executive_summary.problem: SECOND phantom orchestrator spawned at 01:41:18 UTC - 70 minutes AFTER killing first phantom
executive_summary.impact: 147s + 453s interleaved metronome pattern for entire 6-hour period
executive_summary.spawn_source: UNKNOWN - scheduled task, startup script, or manual launch
executive_summary.action_required: URGENT - Find and disable phantom spawn source

metronome_pattern_analysis.interpretation: Both orchestrators running NEW CODE, both logging schedule_source='timer', creating interleaved pattern

hypotheses.hypothesis: Scheduled task on hourly boundary (02:00, 03:00, etc.)
hypotheses.evidence_for: Spawned at 02:41:18 local, close to hourly interval
Start time doesn't match scheduled interval
hypotheses.evidence_against: User reported going to sleep, unlikely manual start at 02:41 AM
System didn't reboot (PID 20144 still running from 00:53:44)

hypotheses.hypothesis: Windows Task Scheduler task with offset trigger
hypotheses.evidence_against: PowerShell commands blocked by Bash environment, can't verify

recommended_investigation: 3. Check triggers for any tasks scheduled on 10-minute, hourly, or system startup
5. Verify only manual START_SYSTEM.bat launches are allowed

current_system_state.verification_window: Next 20 minutes (2 R4 probes) to confirm single metronome

6_hour_operational_summary.metronome_health: FAILED - interleaved pattern indicates dual timers
6_hour_operational_summary.phantom_status: RESPAWNED - second phantom detected and killed

ceo_action_required.action: Manually open Task Scheduler and disable ALL orchestrator-related scheduled tasks
ceo_action_required.verification: After disabling, monitor for 1 hour to ensure no new phantoms spawn
ceo_action_required.permanent_fix: Ensure orchestrator ONLY started via manual START_SYSTEM.bat execution
questions: Q1: Did you manually start a second orchestrator at ~02:41 AM?
Q2: Do you have any scheduled tasks for orchestrator auto-start?
Q3: Should orchestrator auto-start on system boot or run continuously?

stig_certification.statement: I, STIG (CTO), certify that a SECOND phantom orchestrator (PID 21460) was detected and TERMINATED at 09:00:00 UTC. This phantom spawned at 01:41:18 UTC, 70 minutes after killing the first phantom (PID 20348). Both phantoms had NEW CODE (schedule_source='timer'), creating 147s/453s interleaved metronome pattern. System ran stable for 6 hours with 83 R4 probes, all with correct metadata, but metronome integrity compromised by dual timers. Spawn source UNKNOWN - requires manual Task Scheduler investigation. Only ONE orchestrator now running (PID 20144).
stig_certification.urgency: P0 - FIND AND DISABLE SPAWN SOURCE IMMEDIATELY
